I'd give this response a grade of 60.

While the response does acknowledge the Roman practice of crucifixion having an impact on the perception of the cross in early Christianity, it doesn't explicitly explore the transformation of the symbol from one of death to one of life and hope, which is the central concern. The response also doesn't mention Jesus' resurrection, which is a crucial aspect of this transformation.

The response does touch on some aspects of the Christian message, such as the cross being seen as a reminder of Jesus' sacrifice and a symbol of victory and salvation, but it doesn't delve deeply enough into the specific transformation from shame to hope that is at the heart of the Christian story.

To improve this response, I would suggest more explicitly exploring how early Christianity transformed the symbol of the cross, highlighting the significance of Jesus' resurrection in this process.
